medium: Ink and light colors on linen
title: Sixteen Rakan
marks:
Signature, Mark, and Inscription

ULC, in Japane ULC: {Bunkyu- mizunoe inu natsu mutsuki shazanro-j
text: Taizan concentrated on landscape painting, switching from the more formal Tosa school style to the freer nanga painting methods. Here, he depicts the 16 disciples of Buddha in a procession through clouds and waves, executed in a free and wild style.
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Dr and Mrs Robert Feinberg
